text: The Sudden Arrival of the Day of the Lord
Now concerning the times and the seasons, brothers, you have no need \add of anything\add* to be written to you,
for \add you\add* yourselves well know that the day of the Lord is coming in the \add same\add* way as a thief in the night.

Whenever they say “Peace and security,” then sudden destruction will overtake them like the birth pains of ⸤a pregnant woman⸥\f + \fr 5:3 \ft Literally “one who has in the belly” \f*, and they will not possibly escape.
But you, brothers, are not in the darkness, so that the day should catch you like a thief,
for you are all sons of light and sons of day. We are not of the night nor of darkness.
So then, we must not sleep like the rest, but must be on the alert and be self-controlled.
For those who sleep, sleep at night, and those who get drunk, are drunk at night.

But \add because\add*\ef + \fr 5:8 \ft Here “\fq because \ft ” is supplied as a component of the participle (“are”) which is understood as causal \ef* we are of the day, we must be sober, \add by\add*\ef + \fr 5:8 \ft Here “\fq by \ft ” is supplied as a component of the participle (“putting on”) which is understood as means \ef* putting on the breastplate of faith and love and \add as\add* a helmet the hope of salvation,
because God did not appoint us for wrath, but for the obtaining of salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ,
who died for us, so that whether we are awake or asleep, we will live at the same time with him.
Therefore encourage one another and build up ⸤each other⸥\f + \fr 5:11 \ft Literally “one the one,” i.e., “one the other” \f*, just as indeed you are doing.
Final Exhortations and Benediction
Now we ask you, brothers, to respect those who labor among you and rule over you in the Lord and admonish you,
and to esteem them beyond all measure in love, because of their work. Be at peace among yourselves.
And we urge you, brothers, admonish the disorderly, console the discouraged, help the sick, be patient toward all \add people\add*.
See to it that no one pays back evil for evil to anyone, but always pursue good toward\f + \fr 5:15 \ft Some manuscripts have “both toward” \f* one another and toward all \add people\add*.
Rejoice always,
pray constantly,
give thanks in everything; for this \add is\add* the will of God for you in Christ Jesus.
Do not quench the Spirit.
Do not despise prophecies,
but examine all \add things\add*; hold fast to \add what is\add* good.
Abstain from every form of evil.
Now may the God of peace himself sanctify you completely, and may your spirit and soul and body be kept complete, blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
The one who calls you \add is\add* faithful, who also will do \add this\add*.
Brothers, pray for us.\f + \fr 5:25 \ft Some manuscripts have “pray for us also” \f*
Greet all the brothers with a holy kiss.
I adjure you by the Lord, have this letter read aloud to all the brothers.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ \add be\add* with you.
